column4: Anyone know a good guide for controlling desktop running ubuntu with a macbook through a wireless router?

basically you just want to pick System > Preferences > Remote Desktop on the desktop to share it, then Internet > Terminal Server Client on the lappy to access it... You'll need to know the IP address of the desktop machine.
and make sure port 5900 isn't open to the outside world (If you're using NAT it probably won't be..)
